body:
The flag comes from LLVM, apparently (in some way?) and I `./configure`d with `--llvm-root=`

Apparenlty system’s `llvm-config` prints options for g++ not clang, but `-Werror` part comes from our side.

Same for me, these flags were definitely used to compile llvm:

```
$ ./configure --prefix=/home/zazdxscf/build/1nonpkgs/rust/usr/local --disable-rpath --enable-manage-submodules --enable-clang --enable-ccache --enable-dist-host-only --disable-valgrind --disable-helgrind --disable-valgrind-rpass --python=/usr/bin/python2 --enable-optimize --enable-optimize-cxx --enable-optimize-llvm --enable-debug --disable-debuginfo --enable-debug-assertions --enable-debuginfo-tests --enable-llvm-assertions --enable-debug-jemalloc --disable-local-rust --disable-llvm-version-check --llvm-root=/usr
...
$ make -j1 -- all NO_REBUILD=1 TIME_PASSES=1 TIME_LLVM_PASSES=1 'RUSTFLAGS=--verbose -Z verbose -Z print-link-args'
cfg: version 1.5.0-dev (747d951e8 2015-10-16)
cfg: build triple x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
cfg: host triples x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
cfg: target triples x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
cfg: enabling debug assertions (CFG_ENABLE_DEBUG_ASSERTIONS)
cfg: host for x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu is x86_64
cfg: os for x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu is unknown-linux-gnu
cfg: good valgrind for x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu is 1
cfg: using CC=ccache clang (CFG_CC)
cfg: using CXX=clang++ (CFG_CXX)
cfg: disabling valgrind run-pass tests
compile: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/rustllvm/ExecutionEngineWrapper.o
x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-clang-3.8: error: unknown argument: '-fvar-tracking-assignments'
x86_64-pc-linux-gnu-clang-3.8: error: unknown argument: '-ftrack-macro-expansion=2'
/home/zazdxscf/build/1nonpkgs/rust/rust/mk/rustllvm.mk:60: recipe for target 'x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/rustllvm/ExecutionEngineWrapper.o' failed
make: *** [x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/rustllvm/ExecutionEngineWrapper.o] Error 1

real    0m1.065s
user    0m0.397s
sys 0m0.447s
```

I was using a recent llvm, with this latest commit on master: https://github.com/llvm-mirror/llvm/commit/bde51df7533ea93e1c12702015c99562f98d6d21

``` bash
$ llvm-config --cflags
-I/usr/include -O2 -pipe -march=native -ggdb -fvar-tracking-assignments -fno-omit-frame-pointer -ftrack-macro-expansion=2 -fstack-protector-all -fPIC  -fPIC -Wall -W -Wno-unused-parameter -Wwrite-strings -Wno-missing-field-initializers -pedantic -Wno-long-long -Wno-comment -Werror=date-time -ffunction-sections -fdata-sections  -D_GNU_SOURCE -D__STDC_CONSTANT_MACROS -D__STDC_FORMAT_MACROS -D__STDC_LIMIT_MACROS
$ llc --version
LLVM (http://llvm.org/):
  LLVM version 3.8.0svn
  Optimized build.
  Default target: x86_64-pc-linux-gnu
  Host CPU: (unknown)

  Registered Targets:
    amdgcn - AMD GCN GPUs
    cpp    - C++ backend
    r600   - AMD GPUs HD2XXX-HD6XXX
    x86    - 32-bit X86: Pentium-Pro and above
    x86-64 - 64-bit X86: EM64T and AMD64
```

Thanks for filing that bug.

I got this same issue when using `--llvm-root` and `--enable-clang` to build rust nightly.
I managed to get past this issue by adding a line similar to the following to the main.mk makefile:
`LLVM_CXXFLAGS_$(1)=$$(subst -Wno-maybe-uninitialized,,$$(LLVM_CXXFLAGS_$(1)))` to strip the invalid flag from the string.

Unfortunately I am now getting the following issue when linking rustc:

```
note: /home/flubba86/Downloads/rust/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage0/lib/rustlib/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/lib/librustc_llvm-bb943c5a.so: undefined reference to `llvm::DIBuilder::createArrayType(unsigned long, unsigned long, llvm::DIType*, llvm::MDTupleTypedArrayWrapper<llvm::DINode>)'

... Lots more undefined references to LLVM objects
```

I dont know how to get the external LLVM ldflags to be appended to the rustc `cc` linking flags. Does anyone know how to get that working?
Triage: upstream bug has no changes, it looks like.
AFAIK w/ the change to rusbuild we should handle this better, so closing.
